businessProfile.name: Pasquale's Pizzeria Napoletana
businessProfile.address: 59 S County Commons Way, Wakefield, RI 02879, USA
businessProfile.formatted_address: 59 S County Commons Way, Wakefield, RI 02879, USA

reviews.text: We just love the food here and have been back many times! This time, Addison B. was our server and went above and beyond to make sure we had a great dining experience. One of us loves the Neapolitan style pizza, and the other the New York style. We‚Äôve never been disappointed! And the tiramisu is heaven on a spoon!

What a treat! Emma was a fantastic server and responded enthusiastically to all our requests.
The food was top-notch! I am a calamari snob, and this one was right at the top: crispy, light, flavorful, and so very tender. We shared a veal parm sandwich that had the best bread crisped to perfection, and the veal had an easy chew with big flavor.
Of course, we had to have a pizza, make it a Grandma's Carni large, and most of it went home with us, so delicious.
The decor was simple but interesting, and the ceiling took it over the top.
There are high-tops, regular tables, and some lovely padded seating.

We came here becausecwe read the pizza was the 13th best in the USA. The NY style cheese pizza did not disappoint. The slices were easy to fold, and the crust was evenly cooked. My husband enjoyed his meatball sub.

When dessert came, we were blown away. The vanilla cheesecake with blueberry sauce was divine.

The only thing I didn't care for was a acoustics. We were in a large room, far away from the occupied tables, but their noises boomed. Luckily, the people left not long after we got there. It's a sensory thing for me, but most people probably wouldn't be bothered.

First time going there. We went for lunch. Calamari for the appetizer was very good. The pizza was thin like a new york style and I did appreciate the crust and dough that was used. I'd like to go there again and try something new. It's worth checking out.

This review is for the deli across the street. The staff is amazingly friendly and accommodating. The food is exceptional, you can taste the quality ingredients. Thanks guys and gals keep up the good work. Also, don‚Äôt forget to grab some gelato it‚Äôs the best

editorial_summary.overview: Wood-fired, specialty pizzas & pasta dishes offered in a laid-back, vintage-chic environment.

recentReviews.text: Food is okay. One of our pizzas was burnt on the bottom. Service took forever. Workers are nice.

We were very happy to try Pasquale‚Äôs award-winning neapolitan pizza. It has been very busy when we have been in the area, and it does not take reservations for less than 5 people. So we went for lunch after Labor Day and enjoyed sharing a 12-inch Napoletana pizza with smoked provola cheese, sweet peas and sausage on a soft and chewy crust. We also had a side of broccoli rabe (which happily was quite mild instead of bitter). Our server was well-informed about the different types of pizzas and ingredients. The terrace was a lovely place to sit outdoors, and we will be back to try more pizzas.
Food here is amazing! The pizza with the yellow tomato sauce is delicious and their Passion Picante cocktail is to die for!
Food is amazing.  Loved the pizza.
I'm rating for the name alone!!! I have never been there yet but I must assume a 4 or I will take this down
The food here is üòçüòçüòçüòçüòçüòç. Luke the bartender is great!!

We just love the food here and have been back many times! This time, Addison B. was our server and went above and beyond to make sure we had a great dining experience. One of us loves the Neapolitan style pizza, and the other the New York style. We‚Äôve never been disappointed! And the tiramisu is heaven on a spoon!

detailedReviews.author: scott sullivan
detailedReviews.text: Just ok

detailedReviews.author: Toni-Marie Alibah
detailedReviews.text: Food is okay. One of our pizzas was burnt on the bottom. Service took forever. Workers are nice.

detailedReviews.author: Pamela Thomas
detailedReviews.text: We were very happy to try Pasquale‚Äôs award-winning neapolitan pizza. It has been very busy when we have been in the area, and it does not take reservations for less than 5 people. So we went for lunch after Labor Day and enjoyed sharing a 12-inch Napoletana pizza with smoked provola cheese, sweet peas and sausage on a soft and chewy crust. We also had a side of broccoli rabe (which happily was quite mild instead of bitter). Our server was well-informed about the different types of pizzas and ingredients. The terrace was a lovely place to sit outdoors, and we will be back to try more pizzas.

detailedReviews.author: Shirleon Benson
detailedReviews.text: Food here is amazing! The pizza with the yellow tomato sauce is delicious and their Passion Picante cocktail is to die for!

detailedReviews.author: Jim M
detailedReviews.text: Food is amazing.  Loved the pizza.

detailedReviews.author: Debra Kay Levi
detailedReviews.text: I'm rating for the name alone!!! I have never been there yet but I must assume a 4 or I will take this down

detailedReviews.author: J P
detailedReviews.text: The food here is üòçüòçüòçüòçüòçüòç. Luke the bartender is great!!

detailedReviews.author: Patricia B
detailedReviews.text: We just love the food here and have been back many times! This time, Addison B. was our server and went above and beyond to make sure we had a great dining experience. One of us loves the Neapolitan style pizza, and the other the New York style. We‚Äôve never been disappointed! And the tiramisu is heaven on a spoon!

detailedReviews.author: Jennifer (Moon Child)
detailedReviews.text: Pizza e fantastico

detailedReviews.author: Michelle Goldstein
detailedReviews.text: Solid NY style pizza, fresh salads and calamari that isn't fried (hooray!) in a mild marinara sauce. Note: pets aren't even allowed on the patio, so we had to take everything to go and sit on the green. Not a big deal, but precarious on a windy day.

detailedReviews.author: Sara Shafaee
detailedReviews.text: Best calamari of my life!

detailedReviews.author: Giani Corvese
detailedReviews.text: Easily the best restaurant I‚Äôve ever been to in fact, it‚Äôs probably the best in the state. The food is nice, fresh, Italian food that tastes amazing.

detailedReviews.author: mikeywes
detailedReviews.text: Best pizza for 30 miles.......not cheap but worth the extra.   Octopus salad is the best.

detailedReviews.author: David Masiello
detailedReviews.text: Best pizza in RI... Mic Drop!

detailedReviews.author: Wendy Beauchaine
detailedReviews.text: Neopolis is an authentic, real Italian experience with imported and fresh ingredients. This has been the closest spot to replicate some of the amazing food in italy. Additionally, many authentic products are sold. Lastly, let‚Äôs not forget the gelato & pastries!

detailedReviews.author: Steven Tracey
detailedReviews.text: Can‚Äôt order online and phone is busy what kind of establishment is this this is unacceptable and ridiculous ur a joke

detailedReviews.author: Amy Brown
detailedReviews.text: We love it here! Best crust üòã

detailedReviews.author: Alex
detailedReviews.text: Not a fan of the online ordering system. No descriptions of the dishes or pizzas. It wouldn‚Äôt take much effort to add the information your customers need. This is just laziness. If you need help I can literally do it for you.

detailedReviews.author: Adam Wilson
detailedReviews.text: Rude hostess, empty tables but told there is a 30-45 minute wait list, but they aren't seating anyone. and there aren't many people waiting.  Place isn't what it used to be.  Same hostess was rude when my inlaws were in town last week when we came for dinner and they were out of SAUSAGE for pizzas!  Wanted to see if they had sausage for pizzas today, guess not, those empty tables must take priority. ‚úåÔ∏è

detailedReviews.author: Diane Forbes
detailedReviews.text: We had a great meal. My husband had spaghetti and meatballs and I had eggplant parmigiana. Delicious and our waitress Molly was very friendly! Will go back again.

detailedReviews.author: Josh Mackey
detailedReviews.text: My favorite pizza in the world!!! Just wish I lived closer and could go more often.

detailedReviews.author: Luzia Moreira Guimaraes
detailedReviews.text: I love this place.  Pizzas there are really good.

detailedReviews.author: Donna ‚ÄúJrsNonna‚Äù Birs
detailedReviews.text:
My friend who lives in South County took me here because we both wanted pizza.
Our waiter was Rob, he was outstanding, kind, attentive and considerate. My friend and I split a pizza, her side was green peppers. My side was mushrooms, it was delicious! We had the Pomegranate Sangria (not a fan) it would be nice if you could add Watermelon Sangria.

detailedReviews.author: Tony Vaccarelli
detailedReviews.text: Very awesome,  definitely one of my all ti.e favs

detailedReviews.author: Michelle Pacheco
detailedReviews.text: 1st time at Pasquales and live 45 min away so don‚Äôt make it to South county to often. The pizza was good mostly the Grandma style and the flavors were very tasty. I hear a lot of hype of their pizza and unpopular opinion it was good but there are amazing places closer to home for pizza that are better in my opinion.

detailedReviews.author: Per Son
detailedReviews.text: We went with a larger group and had two small ones. The waiter Victor was beyond helpful and patient with us. He was able to customize our meals and was not phased by the food left behind the babies (they were worse than usual on this night). We had so many great pizzas and a fun night out.

detailedReviews.author: Paul Delfino
detailedReviews.text: I have eaten here on numerous occasions the pizza is amazing and the service is great.

detailedReviews.author: Christopher Cooper
detailedReviews.text: Great pizza, in a lively setting. Neapolitan style pizza with many variations available. Service was very good.

detailedReviews.author: John Lepore
detailedReviews.text: True old school Neopolitan pizza in addition to the usual Italian classics.

detailedReviews.author: Julie Hetrick
detailedReviews.text: I have dined at this restaurant many times, tonight was a huge disappointment, the calamari was bland, the pizza was a disappointment and the drinks were awful. The party next to us were catered to ( clearly familiar to the bartenders) while it took forever for all of our courses. Hopefully this was a one off

detailedReviews.author: Debbie McCaffrey
detailedReviews.text: The best pizza!

detailedReviews.author: Paul Whittaker
detailedReviews.text: Amazing pizza here.  The best I‚Äôve had in a long time!

detailedReviews.author: James G
detailedReviews.text: I've had pizza from hundreds and hundreds of different restaurants including one in Naples and other places in Italy and I can say without a doubt that Pasquale's is the best pizza in America.

detailedReviews.author: Debbie Vesce
detailedReviews.text: Wonderful food, loving workers, amazing tasteful Italian food!

detailedReviews.author: Pennie Shaw
detailedReviews.text:
What a treat! Emma was a fantastic server and responded enthusiastically to all our requests.
The food was top-notch! I am a calamari snob, and this one was right at the top: crispy, light, flavorful, and so very tender. We shared a veal parm sandwich that had the best bread crisped to perfection, and the veal had an easy chew with big flavor.
Of course, we had to have a pizza, make it a Grandma's Carni large, and most of it went home with us, so delicious.
The decor was simple but interesting, and the ceiling took it over the top.
There are high-tops, regular tables, and some lovely padded seating.

detailedReviews.author: Gail Thibaudeau
detailedReviews.text: Terrible experience we were at tower hill brewering and ordered a pizza table top advertisement said they would run it over but when it took past the time they said I called and they said they don‚Äôt deliver walked over and got my pizza it was cold and not even cut . What a sad experience . Threw my pizza in the trash . I paid an online tip for delivery that never happened . Terrible experience. I would order from another restaurant that will actually deliver to the brewery .

detailedReviews.author: Christina J Donato
detailedReviews.text:
We came here becausecwe read the pizza was the 13th best in the USA. The NY style cheese pizza did not disappoint. The slices were easy to fold, and the crust was evenly cooked. My husband enjoyed his meatball sub.

When dessert came, we were blown away. The vanilla cheesecake with blueberry sauce was divine.

The only thing I didn't care for was a acoustics. We were in a large room, far away from the occupied tables, but their noises boomed. Luckily, the people left not long after we got there. It's a sensory thing for me, but most people probably wouldn't be bothered.

detailedReviews.author: Debra Walland
detailedReviews.text: Had the worst veal parm sandwich...so disappointed. Yes it was real veal but burnt to dry leather. Should have never left the kitchen. Unfortunately, it was a takeout order, so didn't get to send it back.

detailedReviews.author: God is Good
detailedReviews.text: This review is for the deli across the street. The staff is amazingly friendly and accommodating. The food is exceptional, you can taste the quality ingredients. Thanks guys and gals keep up the good work. Also, don‚Äôt forget to grab some gelato it‚Äôs the best

detailedReviews.author: Noah L
detailedReviews.text: I got a take out King Ferdinando pizza, probably in the top 3 of pizza for me. Took my first bite and was astounded by the taste and the crust was perfect. Also, the staff was very friendly and efficient. 10/10 recommend trying this place

detailedReviews.author: Lin Lee
detailedReviews.text: Delicious,  hot, fun atmosphere.  Everything is amazing!

detailedReviews.author: Milena Fernandes
detailedReviews.text: Came here for lunch alone today during a work trip. Sat outside and enjoyed the gorgeous sun. The waiter was so nice I wish I remembered his name. I started with a nice refreshing margarita, an arugula salad. I‚Äôve never had the arugula salad with crisp pears, Gorgonzola cranberries and pistachios before. To die for!! Had the NY style mozzarella and added roasted garlic. Perfection.

detailedReviews.author: Alex Osorio
detailedReviews.text: First time going there. We went for lunch. Calamari for the appetizer was very good. The pizza was thin like a new york style and I did appreciate the crust and dough that was used. I'd like to go there again and try something new. It's worth checking out.

detailedReviews.author: Matt Beagen
detailedReviews.text: excellent overall experience at Pasquale's...Grandma-style pie was outstanding!

detailedReviews.author: Andrew Shea
detailedReviews.text: The atmosphere is nice and the food is okay but the prices are high and I think you may be able to do better at one of the other pizza places in town that may not be as pretty inside but will feel a whole lot better in your wallet and in your belly

detailedReviews.author: Bradford Simpson
detailedReviews.text: In house dining is OK, never order pick up! You‚Äôll have a couple of birthdays waiting!

detailedReviews.author: Ben Rudgley
detailedReviews.text: Great pizza, great atmosphere! A restaurant for all occasions - family gatherings, an impromptu dinner, date night or simply a place to go eat, drink and watch sports

detailedReviews.author: faye polisi
detailedReviews.text: Delicious

detailedReviews.author: pg
detailedReviews.text: I ordered 2 pizzas and the total was $76. Insane. Can‚Äôt support this business anymore with these predatory prices.

detailedReviews.author: Christopher Baldo
detailedReviews.text:
Stopped in for a quick pizza at lunch.
Fast service, good pizza.

detailedReviews.author: Sean Lavery
detailedReviews.text: 10/10. I own a pizza place - this spot is legit. Ask for the ny well done imo but everything is delicious. Chocolate cr√®me brulee is a must.

detailedReviews.author: Heather Heitmueller
detailedReviews.text: Great place!

detailedReviews.author: Madelane Dixon
detailedReviews.text: Delicious food and great service!

detailedReviews.author: Jeffrey Bakota
detailedReviews.text: Wood fire pizza is my go-to. Just get like 4 of them for a party of 4 amd enjoy.

detailedReviews.author: Jay Baccala
detailedReviews.text: Excellent!

detailedReviews.author: Ana Huynh
detailedReviews.text: Ordered pizza for family who came for graduation at URI so did not eat in. Very cute place, very nice and helpful staff and the pizzas we ordered were delicious.

detailedReviews.author: Sean K
detailedReviews.text: Some of the best thin crust pizza

detailedReviews.author: Victoria Shepard
detailedReviews.text: Came on the recommendation of a few classmates, and it's worth the hype! The Napoli pizza is phenomenal. Great crust texture and fresh ingredients make for an authentic pizza experience!

detailedReviews.author: YellowGlassesGirl
detailedReviews.text: The food and service was amazing the atmosphere isn't my taste but if others were to picked here I'd be happy to go again. The tomatoes of the pizza we got were so unique.

detailedReviews.author: Rob Falco
detailedReviews.text: Real pizza.

detailedReviews.author: Kevin Emery
detailedReviews.text: The Best in RI!

detailedReviews.author: Brian Martin
detailedReviews.text:
The pizza was proper.
The service was great.
Bidet towels for napkins.
Very expensive.
15 us dollar per glass of 5 euro per bottle of wine.
23 dollar pepperoni pizza.
27 dollar speciality pizza.
17 dollar calamari.
No view of il mare.
Ciao

detailedReviews.author: Evan Malmud
detailedReviews.text:
Great sandwiches and pizza. The staff was very friendly. Will be heading back for those again and to try out the desserts.
My only gripe is that they don't sell your average soda because everything is specialized, would've loved to just have been able to grab a few cans of soda with our Togo order.

detailedReviews.author: stonecutter1893
detailedReviews.text: Outstanding Neapolitan pizza..not fake marketed ny style. Believe it or not they had some of the best calamari around too.

detailedReviews.author: Theresa Berard
detailedReviews.text: Enjoyed sharing the Grandma Carni pizza with my family on Mother's Day. We sat at the pizza bar, which was entertaining for the kiddo and the adults. The staff was friendly and made sure to seat us as quickly as possible on a busy day. The crust was crusty, the mozz was mozzy, chewy - how they would do it in Italia - not stringyüëåperfetto! The peach Negroni was top notch, so I took my time. And I got to practice Italian, which was extra special. We can't wait to come back üíØ

detailedReviews.author: motomarkus
detailedReviews.text: The best. Great vibe and open atmosphere, and you won't find a better pizza anywhere!

detailedReviews.author: Joseph Young
detailedReviews.text: The pizza offered a remarkable culinary experience.  Its flavors were reminiscent of authentic Neapolitan pizza. The crust was perfectly balanced between crispy and chewy. Fresh, high-quality ingredients elevated the taste to another level.  It was a truly memorable pizza.

detailedReviews.author: Travissa Tallo
detailedReviews.text: If your looking for calamari this is the place to go best calamari I've had so far

detailedReviews.author: Joe R outdoorsman
detailedReviews.text: One of the best pizzas I've ever had. The Mediterranean salad with chicken cutlet is delicious. This place also has the best servers. They're always in a good mood, very knowledgeable, and pleasant to talk to. Excellent restaurant

detailedReviews.author: JD Hernandez
detailedReviews.text: While the pizza here had fantastic flavor. The service was a bit rude when it came to questions about the menu. The atmosphere was really friendly but my party was seated a little too close to another party so we felt crowded, almost afraid to hit them when we pushed out our chair. I would recommend as a family friendly place and a place to go to watch futbol if interested.

detailedReviews.author: OG Papafern
detailedReviews.text: Beautiful pizzeria with a shrine to Diego Maradona. Amazing pizzas!!!

detailedReviews.author: Chris Morelli
detailedReviews.text: Pasquale's Pizzeria is a must for delicious Italian cuisine!  The pizza is authentic Italian pizza.   We had Grandma's Meat pizza which was as good as my Italian Grandmothers pizza, if not better (sorry, Grandma!).  The Italian specials and meals are wonderful!  The atmosphere is like being in Italy!  I love the videos playing of a walking tour of Italian towns.  I felt like I was back there.   It's a must when visiting South County!!!

detailedReviews.author: Carlos Mouta
detailedReviews.text: Best Pizza in Rhode Island

detailedReviews.author: Elise L
detailedReviews.text: Delicious! We really enjoyed the meatball appetizer, NY style meatball & ricotta and Margarita wood fired pizzas. Ryan was a great server!

detailedReviews.author: Jim Lafleur
detailedReviews.text: Bartender open up my beer with his bare hands touching the tip of my bottle and did not give me a glass asked three times finally the third person I asked got me a glass it's not like he was busy or anything not very personable basically threw my pizza at me awful bartenders very snobby

customerMoodAnalysis.sentimentSummary: Customers have positive experiences overall. Your 4.5/5 rating from 100 recent reviews shows solid satisfaction with room for growth.

strengthsPerceived: Customers rave about Pasquale's authentic Neapolitan and New York style pizzas, highlighting the unique ingredients like smoked provola cheese and yellow tomato sauce. - social media marketing can showcase this strength
The restaurant is praised for its exceptional dining experience, with attentive servers like Addison B. and a lovely outdoor terrace for dining. - review management can highlight this positive aspect
The use of fresh, imported ingredients and authentic Italian dishes, such as the octopus salad and gelato, are highly appreciated by customers. - SEO services can leverage this for better visibility
improvementOpportunities: Long wait times and poor service experience - Boostly marketing services can improve this
Negative reviews and reputation issues due to inconsistent food quality and service - review management can address this concern
Poor online ordering experience and lack of dish descriptions - SEO services can solve this visibility issue

positive.author: Pamela Thomas
positive.text: We were very happy to try Pasquale‚Äôs award-winning neapolitan pizza. It has been very busy when we have been in the area, and it does not take reservations for less than 5 people. So we went for lunch after Labor Day and enjoyed sharing a 12-inch Napoletana pizza with smoked provola cheese, sweet peas and sausage on a soft and chewy crust. We also had a side of broccoli rabe (which happily was quite mild instead of bitter). Our server was well-informed about the different types of pizzas and ingredients. The terrace was a lovely place to sit outdoors, and we will be back to try more pizzas.

positive.text: Food here is amazing! The pizza with the yellow tomato sauce is delicious and their Passion Picante cocktail is to die for!

positive.author: Jim M
positive.text: Food is amazing.  Loved the pizza.

recommendations.description: Encourage satisfied customers to leave reviews
